timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch into subselect_unresolved_bugfix

timeline.body: I don't think this is needed anymore - see `AnalyzeRule` which takes care of skipping if the node is resolved and `skipResolved` is true (default).
timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is needed anymore - see AnalyzeRule which takes care of skipping if the node is resolved and skipResolved is true (default).
timeline.bodyHTML: I don't think this is needed anymore - see AnalyzeRule which takes care of skipping if the node is resolved and skipResolved is true (default).
timeline.author: costin

timeline.body: I'd pick a different name - maybe `DefaultAnalyzeRule` or `BaseAnalyzeRule`.
timeline.bodyText: I'd pick a different name - maybe DefaultAnalyzeRule or BaseAnalyzeRule.
timeline.bodyHTML: I'd pick a different name - maybe DefaultAnalyzeRule or BaseAnalyzeRule.
timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: I was struggling with the name, indeed. I didn't particularly like LogicalPlanAnalyzeRule, but didn't find any better alternatives.
replies.author: astefan

timeline.body: `rulePlan` is repetitive (the method only accepts `LogicalPlan`s)  - how about `doRule` or `analyze`?
timeline.bodyText: rulePlan is repetitive (the method only accepts LogicalPlans)  - how about doRule or analyze?
timeline.bodyHTML: rulePlan is repetitive (the method only accepts LogicalPlans) - how about doRule or analyze?
